ygData.subject: RE: revenge is sweet you know...
ygData.msgSnippet: any alchemy shop supposedly has them, and it does infact dispell sow, we ve unbuffed ourselves a few times by accident.
ygData.messageBody:
any alchemy shop supposedly has them, and it does infact dispell sow, we've
unbuffed ourselves a few times by accident.



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [SMTP:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: September 14, 1999 4:35 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] revenge is sweet you know...
>
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> I have heard about the Pumice stone dispelling buffs but I have never used
> it myself or witnessed anyone ever using it before. Where can you
> find/buy
> them at? Also, do they dispel both positive and negative buffs or only
> negative buffs? If they only dispel negative buffs, I wouldn't think they
> would cancel SOW since the game classifies that as a positive buff. Can
> you
> provide more info on how pumice works?
>
> I love this list. Learn something new every day:-)
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
> > From: "CYR, Thierry" <tcyr@...>
> >
> > When a kiter is hassling you, get some pumice and haul it around with
> you,
> > it has effect of dispell. So if a druid sow's you you can remove it. Or
> > even
> > better if he for instance is kiting a giant, he's using sow, and his
> giant
> > is snared, dispell them both and watch him get out of this one, this has
> > been very usefull for us when a couple of high level shamans tried to
> > steal
> > our very nasty named hill giant once. (Brood Bloodbeard).
>

>
